result.execSummary:
The defendant Jenard J Roberson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: The Court sentenced defendant to a maximum term of imprisonment of 6 years; 3 years of initial confinement; 3 years of extended supervision.  Defendant IS NOT eligible for CIP or WSAP programs. Court STAYED THIS SENTENCE and placed the defendant on PROBATION.
Conditions SAME as probation. (Exception of PH time ordered)

miscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 1 YEAR 
   in the House of Correction.  FORTHWITH. 
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 60 days
   in the House of Correction.  Stayed Pending Review.
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, Deonna F., 
   without prior court approval.   
* Obtain GED/HSED.
* Obtain and maintain employment.  
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by
   the Department of Corrections, during period of 
   probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.  
* Restitution is set at zero.
* Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
* Drive only if licensesd and insured.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil eights are restored.

timeConds.notes: No release..............****DECISION & ORDER:  Sept 26, 2014/Judge Flanagan/Defendant is graanted HOC good time credit while serving the conditional jail term of this case.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jenard J Roberson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Granting Request for Good Time Credit, signed and filed.
-- IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that the defendant is granted House of Correction good time credit while serving the conditional jail term of this case.   mld
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Mel Flanagan, Br. 4, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se request for good time and DRC.

Defendant Jenard J Roberson in court with attorney Crystal L. Saltzwadel.  Defendant Jenard J Roberson in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Courts finds that State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   AS TO AMENDED COUNT #4: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS, with credit for 106 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".

The Court STAYED this sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 3 YEARS with the following conditions:  
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 1 YEAR 
   in the House of Correction.  FORTHWITH. 
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 60 days
   in the House of Correction.  Stayed Pending Review.
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, Deonna F., 
   without prior court approval.   
* Obtain GED/HSED.
* Obtain and maintain employment.  
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by
   the Department of Corrections, during period of 
   probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.  
* Restitution is set at zero.
* Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
* Drive only if licensesd and insured.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.   mld

Attorney Crystal L Saltzwadel in court, defendant Jenard J Roberson not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Video viewed by the Court and counsel, prior to hearing.  For the reasons as stated on the record, the Court DENIED defense motion to modify bail, and ordered defendant REMANDED pending the Sentencing Hearing, dated 7-11-2014 at 1:30 pm in Branch 4.   mld

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion fo the State, Court ordered COUNTS #1, #2, and #3 dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered that the while armed enhancer is dismissed and read-in on count #4.  

AS TO COUNT AMENDED #4 (w/o while armed enhancer) Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.   Statement made by victim: Deanna F.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 7-11-2014 at 1:30 pm.  

Upon the request of the State, Court ordered case adjourned for Bail / Bond Hearing in Branch 4 on 6-19-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld

Defendant Jenard J Roberson in court with attorney Crystal L Saltzwadel.  Defendant Jenard J Roberson in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 "On states motion, Court AMENDED the Charge of COUNT #4, to 2nd Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety (Domestic Abuse), Contrary to Wisconsin State Statute(s) 941.30(2), a Class G Felony."   mld
dated 6-16-2014, addressed to the Court from Wanda Williams (mother of defendant), received and filed.   mld

Attorney Crystal L Saltzwadel in court, defendant Jenard J Roberson not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Final Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 6-18-2014 at 8:30 am.  Defense is requesting that the next date be scheduled for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.   mld

Defendant Jenard J Roberson in court with attorney Crystal L. Saltzwadel.  Defendant Jenard J Roberson in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Due to ADA assignment case is assigned to branch 04, Judge Flanagan. 
BRANCH 23 FOR BRANCH 04
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Susan Stirmer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.    Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Deonna F, her residence and family as well as the LaQuinta Inn located at 5443 N. Lovers Lane Rd. and Christopher S.

Defendant Jenard J Roberson in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Defendant Jenard J Roberson in custody.  Lucy J. Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant enters a plea of not guilty as to misdemeanor counts 1, 2 and 3.
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
